## See tests in `semmcci_notes`


```{r setup}
library(testthat)
library(semmcci)
library(lavaan)
```


## With Defined Parameters


```{r defined}
# Generate Data ------------------------------------------------------------
n <- 1000
x <- rnorm(n = n)
m <- 0.50 * x + rnorm(n = n)
y <- 0.25 * x + 0.50 * m + rnorm(n = n)
data <- data.frame(x, m, y)

# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
  ab := a * b
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model,
  fixed.x = FALSE
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
```


## Without Defined Parameters


```{r without_defined}
# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
```



```{r }
test_that("TRUE", {
  expect_true(
    TRUE
  )

```
